page.title: 09BRIDGES STONE
page.content: South of Alfrick is the Leigh Brook, which was used to provide power for two mills, at the beginning of the 18th.Century.Gunnicks Mill produced and dyed cloth.By the early 19th. Centurythe mill was no longer used for making cloth, but for turning old cloth into poor quality paper caps.At the other end of the site on the opposite side of the stream was a clover mill, which was used for separating the seed from the clover plant after harvesting.A flour mill was later added. The flour mill had two overshot mill wheels, each 14' 3" in diameter.The flour mill was a working mill until 1937 still powered by water.In 1937 it was taken over by an engineering firm,Costellos. They used direct drive from the mill wheels to power their machinery.
